Substrate API Sidecar

REST API Documentation
v20.5.0
REST service that makes it easy to interact with blockchain nodes built using Substrate's FRAME framework.

API Endpoints

    Data Schemas

        Substrate API Sidecar

        v20.5.0 GitHub

        REST service that makes it easy to interact with blockchain nodes built using Substrate's FRAME framework.

        Account Management

        Query account balances, staking info, and transaction history

        Block Explorer

        Access detailed block information, extrinsics, and events

        Runtime Access

        Query runtime metadata, pallets, and storage items

        Transaction Tools

        Estimate fees, construct transactions, and submit to network

        Quick Start

        Example Request 
        curl http://localhost:8080/blocks/head
        Try it out: Each endpoint includes an interactive API explorer. Note that browser requests may be blocked by CORS policies when testing against external servers. The localhost server typically allows cross-origin requests.

        Getting Started

        v20.5.0 GitHub

        Installation & Setup

        1

        Install Dependencies

        npm 
        npm install @substrate/api-sidecar

        or with Yarn:

        yarn 
        yarn add @substrate/api-sidecar
        2

        Start the Service

        Start Server 
        substrate-api-sidecar

        The service will start on http://localhost:8080 by default.

        3

        Make Your First Request

        Test Request 
        curl http://localhost:8080/blocks/head

        This returns information about the latest block.

        Configuration

        Environment variables for customizing the service:

        SAS_SUBSTRATE_WS_URL
        WebSocket endpoint for the Substrate node
        SAS_SUBSTRATE_URL
        HTTP endpoint for the Substrate node
        SAS_EXPRESS_PORT
        Port for the HTTP server (default: 8080)
        SAS_EXPRESS_BIND_HOST
        Host address to bind to (default: 127.0.0.1)

        Key Features

        Account Management

        Comprehensive account operations and balance queries

        • Account balance information
        • Staking rewards and payouts
        • Vesting schedules
        • Transaction history
        • Multi-signature operations

        Block Explorer

        Deep blockchain data access and exploration tools

        • Block information and headers
        • Extrinsic details and events
        • Transaction traces
        • Block range queries
        • Real-time finality tracking

        Runtime Access

        Query runtime metadata and pallet information

        • Runtime metadata
        • Pallet information
        • Storage queries
        • Constant values
        • Call information

        Transaction Tools

        Transaction construction and fee estimation

        • Fee estimation
        • Transaction construction
        • Dry run operations
        • Submission queue status
        • Transaction pool monitoring

        Technical Features

        RESTful API

        Clean, intuitive HTTP endpoints following REST principles

        OpenAPI Specification

        Complete API documentation with schemas and examples

        TypeScript Support

        Full TypeScript definitions for type-safe development

        Error Handling

        Comprehensive error responses with detailed messages
